p: Right myocardial strain can be seen as a result of pulmonary embolism, which has been reported as the most common thrombotic complication in COVID-19 patients ( 53), or due to pulmonary hypertension, causing increased right sided pressures secondary to severe ARDS, sepsis, or heart failure ( 54). On the one hand, increased right atrial pressure along with increased sympathetic tone in patients with pulmonary hypertension and hypoxia can predispose to increased risk of atrial tachyarrhythmias ( 55). On the other hand, a case of temporary occurrence of S1Q3T3, which has been previously described in this review, was found to have transient complete heart block suggested to be due to transient pulmonary artery hypertension ( 20).
